column4: How do I change my monitor hz from 60hz to 90hz? The normal way only allows 60hz :'(
the HZ is decided from the vertical and horizontal refresh rates in the X11.conf
So how do I change the hz?
you have to edit the vert and horiz refresh rates in the X11config
you have to do it as root
but it's a bad idea if you don't know what your doing -
maybe there is some gui for it - lemme boot up my ubuntu
You can only select 60Hz on in the "screen Resolution Preferences"-dialog?
sorry, I don't know how to do it with gui'stuff - only by editing files. - But you might break stuff if you edit files.
can you send me a modified version of xorg.conf?
I dont know the values for your monitor
How would I find those out for you?
I dont know - but I don't have time for that, sorry
